name: Mild Turkey Albóndigas Soup with Rice
description: Family-friendly Mexican-style turkey meatball soup simmered in a tomato-chicken broth with rice, carrots, and potatoes. Mild seasoning and bright lime make it comforting and approachable.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a baking tray.
Finely chop onions (1 large total; divide for meatballs and soup).
Mince garlic (4 cloves total; divide for meatballs and soup).
Peel and dice carrots (2 medium) and potatoes (2 medium) into small cubes.
Rinse jasmine rice (3/4 cup) under cold water until it runs clear.

In a bowl, combine turkey, half the chopped onions, half the minced garlic, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, and cornflour; mix gently and form 16 small meatballs.
Open diced tomatoes (1 can) and have chicken stock and water measured.
Roughly chop coriander and cut lime into wedges for serving.
cook_steps: Arrange turkey meatballs on the lined tray, brush lightly with olive oil, and bake for 10–12 minutes until just set and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, heat 1.5 tbsp olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add remaining onions and carrots; cook 4–5 minutes until softened.
Stir in remaining garlic; cook 30 seconds. Add 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp paprika, a pinch of black pepper, and a small pinch of salt; toast 30 seconds.
Add diced potatoes, diced tomatoes, chicken stock, and water along with 1 bay leaf. Bring to a boil.
Stir in rinsed jasmine rice. Reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook 12–15 minutes, stirring once or twice to prevent sticking.
Add the baked meatballs to the pot. Simmer uncovered 8–10 minutes more, until meatballs are cooked through and rice and potatoes are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Stir in half the chopped coriander. Ladle into bowls and finish with remaining coriander and a squeeze of lime.
